meanings.sent1: The new law democratized access to education for all citizens.
meanings.sent2: The internet has democratized information, allowing people from all over the world to access it.
meanings.sent3: The library democratized its collection by offering free memberships to everyone in the community.
meanings.sent4: The invention of the printing press democratized knowledge, spreading it far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The charity event aimed to democratize healthcare by providing free medical services to all attendees.

meanings.definition: To bring (something) under democratic control or influence.
meanings.sent1: The movement successfully democratized the decision-making process within the organization.
meanings.sent2: The protestors aimed to democratize the government, giving power back to the people.
meanings.sent3: The students tried to democratize the classroom by voting on the next assignment.
meanings.sent4: The new policy democratized the workplace, allowing employees to have a say in company decisions.
meanings.sent5: The campaign sought to democratize access to healthy food options in underserved communities.
